intro: Zeyherella mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It is a small shrub, typically growing up to 1 meter in height, and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
